Comment: Someone can think he's focusing on the wrong priorities and still overall approve. But people get way too caught up in sample size when it's way less important than people think. What actually matters is methodology and getting a representative sample, if you can do that a sample size of 100 is actually, believe it or not, just as good for a 10,000 people group as it is for a 10 million people one. Of course, getting a representative sample from a larger population might necessitate a larger sample size to fully capture the diversity of the population (if there's a group that only makes up 1/10000 people, a 1000 sample size is likely to not include them at all for example). It's like a soup, if it's well mixed a spoonful will be enough to tell if it's seasoned properly no matter how large the pot is.
